title: Avdotya Timofeyeva
text:
Avdotia Timofeyeva (1739-?), was a Russian <a href="ballerina">ballerina</a>. She belonged to the first group of ballet dancers in the history of Russian ballet. Timofejeva was a part of the first group of ballet students trained by the founder of the Russian ballet, <a href="Jean-Baptiste%20Land%C3%A9">Jean-Baptiste Landé</a>, and was given a position in the ballet of the Imperial theatres in 1748. She performed many parts in the ballets by <a href="Giovanni%20Battista%20Locatelli%20%28opera%20director%29">Giovanni Battista Locatelli</a> and <a href="Antonio%20Sacco">Antonio Sacco</a>.
Sources.
Авдотья (Тимофеевна) // Энциклопедический словарь, составленный русскими учеными и литераторами. СПб., 1861.
